body:
> I'm 90% positive I was running with that flag - maybe the VERSION number needs to get bumped up?

Nah, `VERSION` is only used with the data sent to Telemetry to differentiate between what code ended up sending which packet, and is mostly unused in that case anyway. Although I didn't bump it when I changed the recipe, which wasn't a great thing  to do.

That traceback in the screenshot shows the error happening in `save`, which was a method on the `HeartbeatFlow` class that actually called `saveHeartbeatFlow`. But that class was deleted in https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/commit/6fd117f4535821733a61e2117826ff46c63ecfb9, which is what leads me to believe your built code is out-of-date.
body_text:
I'm 90% positive I was running with that flag - maybe the VERSION number needs to get bumped up?

Nah, VERSION is only used with the data sent to Telemetry to differentiate between what code ended up sending which packet, and is mostly unused in that case anyway. Although I didn't bump it when I changed the recipe, which wasn't a great thing  to do.
That traceback in the screenshot shows the error happening in save, which was a method on the HeartbeatFlow class that actually called saveHeartbeatFlow. But that class was deleted in 6fd117f, which is what leads me to believe your built code is out-of-date.
body_html:
I'm 90% positive I was running with that flag - maybe the VERSION number needs to get bumped up?

Nah, VERSION is only used with the data sent to Telemetry to differentiate between what code ended up sending which packet, and is mostly unused in that case anyway. Although I didn't bump it when I changed the recipe, which wasn't a great thing to do.

That traceback in the screenshot shows the error happening in save, which was a method on the HeartbeatFlow class that actually called saveHeartbeatFlow. But that class was deleted in 6fd117f, which is what leads me to believe your built code is out-of-date.
